title: Online Game Programmer (C++) - Game Services
description:
As an Online Game Programmer at Embark, you will be working on our recently announced games ARC Raiders and THE FINALS, alongside some of the most talented people in the games industry.
   

  

 You will be a part of Game Services, a strategic team with mixed competences, and we provide online services and integration to our games. We work closely with the game teams and deliver online services to a high quality and make sure they are operational.
   

  

 Examples of such services are Persistent Inventory, Friends, Voice Chat, Anti-Cheat, Progression and Store.
   

  

 The games are being built in Unreal Engine, using C++, a scripting language called Angelscript and some blueprints.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Create the core metagame systems for our games
* Collaborate with game designers to find innovative new ways to engage our players
* Design and develop the friends, party and chat systems
* Use data as a guide when designing matchmaking rules


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* A strong background in C++
* An ambition in pushing the boundaries of "next gen"
* A good grasp of what social and metagame looks and feels like
* A fluent English - our team comes from all over the world
* An interest in computer science and programming as a craft


**Additionally one or some of these would be a great bonus**
* Professional experience with Online systems in games
* Experience working with or close to game design
* Backend services development experience


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!
   

  

*If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "* 
*Open Application.* 
*"*

title: Data Engineer
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Do you want to join the technological revolution? Tendium is looking for a
 *Data Engingeer* 
 to join the team.**
*Procurement information is available across all kinds of sources and in all kinds of formats. As a data engineer at Tendium, you will work with building and maintaining systems to collect, enrich and manage this information, and make sure that our customers are able to extract and get value from it while using our product suite.*
 Why Tendium
   

  

 Tendium is a forward leaning company that is all about creating value - both for our customers, but also for society at large. Increasing the efficiency of the competition for public contracts, and the accessibility of information about them, is a cornerstone in efficient use of taxpayer money. Making this happen through use of cutting edge technology and innovative solutions is what we’re all about.
   

  

 We are an ever-growing company comprised of some of the sharpest minds in Sweden. With such talent, we at Tendium naturally believe in a flat hierarchy where everyone has responsibility, autonomy, and the opportunity to provide input. Since we are increasing in size significantly, new opportunities are constantly emerging. We require ambitious, conscientious, and value-driven new colleagues to help grow the business. If you are successful in becoming a part of our team, we promise to provide a dynamic and intellectually stimulating workplace. We believe that personal and professional development is crucial, and as such, you will have the opportunity to take on real responsibility from day one.
   

  

 The Job
   

  

 The work environment will be agile, and you’ll work alongside self-sustaining teams. Your team will have full ownership over the products and features you create, leveraging continuous delivery practices. We strive towards having development teams at Tendium that are self-reliant, comprising a spectrum of skills encompassing backend, frontend, infrastructure, and dev-ops expertise.
   

  

 As a team, we always strive to use state-of-the-art technology and stay at the forefront of development. Working agile means that we build minimum viable products, but we always aim for high-quality code. Moreover, we want everyone to contribute with thoughts and ideas, whether it is in their area of expertise or not. And if you want to dig deep in a technical area you will always find someone interested in the team
   

  

 We are looking for primarily Stockholm based candidates and we work in a hybrid environment. We regularly organise after work activities and we want to maintain our friendly and informal atmosphere.
   

  

**Our Current Stack**
* Backend: Python, NodeJS (TypeScript), GraphQL (microservice architecture)
* DBs: DocumentDB (MongoDB), PostgreSQL
* Infrastructure: AWS containerized and serverless compute through TypeScript CDK
* Languages: Python (primary backend), Typescript (backend and infrastructure)


**Who We Are Looking For**
 For this position, we seek an individual who can demonstrate responsibility and initiative, as well as great attention to detail. You should value structure and possess a good ability to write scalable code at both macro and micro levels. You need to be comfortable with data modelling and have an understanding of how data decisions made upstream in a data pipeline affect end results.
   

  

 At Tendium, the tech teams work with continuous delivery and we aim for fast delivery with quality code, without over-engineering. We value constructive problem solving and are looking for someone who enjoys taking on new tasks and features and appreciates learning about and using new technology and solutions. Furthermore, we are on the lookout for individuals who find fulfilment in collaborative problem-solving and appreciate collaborating closely with team and colleagues (e.g. pair programming), and that is why we are looking for those qualities in you.
   

  

 Ideal candidates should have a few years of experience in backend development with a focus on data engineering.
   

  

 Note that by experience, we do not necessarily mean employment. We care about what you can do, not how long you’ve been on the payroll. We are open to ambitious candidates who have recently graduated, as long as they can demonstrate extraordinary understanding of what the role entails and how they can contribute.
   

  

**Requirements**
* MSc Degree in computer science or similar
* Backend programming experience in Python and/or TypeScript
* Data engineering experience (building pipelines, setting up data storages, database migrations, quality assurance and validation flows e.t.c.)
* Based in Stockholm or surrounding areas
* Fluent in English


**Meritorious**
* Experience managing NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB
* Experience with data analytics
* Knowledge of AWS Infrastructure
* Experience working with scrum or other forms of agile development such as ShapeUp


 For this role, we offer a permanent employment (
 *Sw: tillsvidareanställning* 
 ) starting with a 6-month probationary period.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 We look forward to your application. We recruit on an ongoing basis, so apply as soon as possible. Successful candidates will be invited to a video interview where you will have the opportunity to meet the team.
   

  

 Please find additional information on our recruitment process here. If you want to know more about our culture and what you can expect when working at Tendium you can read more about it
 *here.*

title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
description:
About us:
   

  

 Leya is working to empower lawyers and automate legal work. Our approach is to enable the lawyer of the future: a human-AI lawyer who's an order of magnitude more effective than a team of conventional legal professionals. The human-AI lawyer will iterate at the speed of their judgment, even in the most complex legal scenarios, and will out-smart and out-deliver the best pure AI system.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit that thousands of lawyers use daily at global institutions such as Bird&Bird, Mannheimer Swartling, and Heineken. Backed by $37M in funding from top investors like Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator, Leya is a group of exceptional engineers, lawyers, and doers. Here, you will have infinite room to grow and rethink how truly worthwhile work gets done.
   

  

**The role:**
 As a Fullstack Engineer at Leya you will build, review and ship amazing products helping legal professionals all over the world in their day-to-day job. You’ll get the chance to work across the entire tech stack with clear ownership and autonomy.
   

  

 What you will be doing:
   

  

* Architect and implement features end-to-end for our web platform
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Work with technologies such as Python, React, Node.js, AWS, Azure and Kubernetes
* Review code and mentor junior colleagues to support them in their development, making the team even better!
* Drive continuous improvement and challenge us, the industry and yourself


 Who you are:
   

  

* A passionate engineer with several years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* You feel comfortable working across the entire tech stack, with focus on backend development
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the code you write
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about software architecture
* Experience in infrastructure and integrations are a big plus


 What’s in it for you:
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Leya with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Leya for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: Sr IT Operations Support Engineer (Adobe/SAS Marketing Automation)
description:
**Job ID: 23314**
 We are now looking for Data Operation Expert to manage and support the 
 



 Marketing Automation application with Adobe Experience Platform and Adobe Journey Optimize.
 





  

  



 At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. 
   

  





**About this opportunity** 






  

  



 Welcome to the Group Data Management and Data Operation team. We add value by providing data and analytics solutions to the rest of the Nordea. 
 



 As the Adobe/SAS Marketing Automation Support Engineer, you’ll play a valuable role in becoming a Subject Matter Expert around application management including different compliance and life cycle management aspects. In your role, you will be working closely with our application owners and provides and supporting them to ensure our applications meet the expected Nordea standards.
 





  
 





 Examples of the solutions we enable via our agile release trains are Common Data Platform (CDP), business data marts, Marketing Automation, AI & Machine Learning application etc.
 





  

  



 This is an opportunity for you to be part of taking Data @ Nordea to the next level and to collaborate with different organization units and teams across the Nordics, Poland and India.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Maintain Journey Optimizer features such as journey orchestration, triggers, automations, actions, messages and offer
* Creating and managing journeys, campaigns, landing pages, assets, and reports in AJO
* Eager to learn new technologies and evaluate new product features
* Should have Excellent communication, presentation, and problem-solving skills



  

  



 The role is based in Gdynia; Copenhagen; Gdańsk; Helsinki; Stockholm.
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Collaborate with the Application Owners & Provider and support them in doing the right things
* Become the subject matter expert around Adobe/SAS application
* Facilitate different kinds of application management processes e.g:
 

	+ Risk management process to ensure we manage our risks in a pro-active and structured manner (RATIS)
	+ Application assessments (e.g. compliancy checks)
	+ Annual budgeting
	+ Drive and coordinate different ad-hoc initiatives and projects that arise around our application landscape



  

  



**Your experience and background:** 





* Knowledge of any marketing automation tool  preferred Adobe Experience Platform and Adobe Journey Optimizer
* Hands-on experience with Hadoop ecosystems, SQL, APIs and basic UNIX commands
* Working knowledge of data management



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 10/01/2025
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact Parag Purushottam Dhonde at parag.dhonde@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 

  
 





**For candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





**For candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 





  

  



 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.
